title: Dean's Welcome
details: All new School of Hotel Administration (SHA) students and family members will be welcomed by Dean Michael Johnson and introduced to SHA's deans, faculty, and administrators. Dean Johnson will offer an overview of what parents and families can expect as their student acclimates to the School of Hotel Administration and Cornell University. Light refreshments will be available in the Statler Auditorium foyer immediately after the Dean's presentation.

title: School of Hotel Administration and Statler Hotel Tours
details: Start times at 11:45am, 12:00pm and 12:15pm. Tours will be conducted by School of Hotel Administration  ambassadors for new students and parents. Meet in the Statler Hall World Atrium to begin your tour.

title: Hotel Administration Students Tour the Tatkon
details: This tour will be led by an upper-level student from your college and will include information about the many interesting programs that the Center offers students throughout the year. For more information on the Tatkon Center, please see page 62 of the Orientation Guide for more information.

title: Cornell Hotel Society Program
details: Students are introduced to the alumni organization of the School of Hotel Administration. The session will include presentations by the leadership of the Cornell Hotel Society and Collegiate Chapter, the director of Alumni Affairs, and the general manager of the Statler Hotel. Learn about other Hotel School clubs and organizations and co-curricular opportunities.

title: Essentials for Early Success
details: A full day of group sessions for new students to be ready and engaged on the first day of classes! This will be an opportunity to get acquainted with each other and with advisors to discuss core curriculum, course scheduling, SHA expectations, and academic strategies for success.

title: 'You Mean, There's Race in My Movie?'
details: Be on time for this riveting exercise in media literacy using a structured analysis of racial archetypes and prototypes used in movies. The workshop offers an in-depth look at contemporary mainstream Hollywood and parses out the complex web of historical, institutional, and financial factors that influence the portrayal of race in mainstream movies.

title: Lunch
details: Immediately following the media presentation, all new students will join faculty, staff,  ambassador peer mentors, and upper-class students for lunch catered by Cornell Catering.

title: Open Advising
details: This time is set aside for faculty to meet with their advisees. Students may also meet with Office of Student Services staff or peer advisors to review any additional questions or concerns they may have.

title: Multicultural Student Welcome Reception
details: Hosted by the Multicultural Programs and National Society of Minorities in Hospitality, this reception welcomes all students to mingle and chat with faculty members and other students.

title: Multicultural/EOP Orientation for Students and Parents
details: For new students from diverse cultural backgrounds and their families; meet with your college advisor.

details: This tour will be led by an upper-level student from your college and will include information about the many interesting programs that the Center offers students throughout the year. For more information on the Tatkon Center, please see page 62 of the Orientation Guide for more information.

title: Dean's Welcome
details: Greeting to new students and families by Alan Mathios, Dean of the College of Human Ecology.

title: College Briefing
details: Mandatory meeting for all new students in the College of Human Ecology. Talk with our Student and Career Development staff about using Orientation to get ready for Cornell's challenges. Learn about College resources. Come with your questions.

title: Meeting for Human Ecology Athletes
details: College of Human Ecology Student and Career Development staff will meet with student athletes to discuss their orientation process and other information relevant to balancing athletics and academics. This meeting is required for new student athletes.

title: Academic Meetings for All New Students
details: Students should plan to spend the day in the College. You will participate in academic Orientation meetings with Human Ecology student development staff and faculty in your academic department. See the detailed Human Ecology Orientation schedule for specifics about time and place, posted on the Human Ecology website at www.human.cornell.edu.

title: Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental Orientation for First-Year and Transfer Students: Preparing for Careers in Human Medicine (Physicians, Dentists, and Related Human Health Professions)
details: Plan your first year to include academic and extracurricular requirements for professions in human medicine. details: Meet with advising staff for conversation about your transition to Cornell, transfer credit, and degree planning. This is a good opportunity to meet other new transfer students.

details: Learn the secrets of MVR! Gather in the Human Ecology Student Lounge for tours led by student Orientation staff.

details: Meet the Career Development Center staff and check out our resources.

title: Office of Student and Career Development Open House
details: Come to meet our staff, introduce yourself to your counselor, and get your questions answered as you prepare to begin classes.

details: This tour will be led by an upper-level student from your college and will include information about the many interesting programs that the Center offers students throughout the year. For more information on the Tatkon Center, please see page 62 of the Orientation Guide.

title: New Student Orientation Meeting
details: All first-year and transfer students are required to attend. Staff members from the Office of Student Services will present information on the School's curriculum, various academic support services, and course scheduling information.

title: ILR Colloquium Meeting
location: Location will be provided at registration
details: This is the first meeting with colloquium instructors, the faculty advisors of first-year students. Details and room assignments are provided at the 9:00am New Student Orientation and Registration Meeting.

title: Student Peer Advisors Meet with New Students
details: New students will be introduced to their Student Advisors in 305 Ives and then will have an opportunity to meet in smaller groups for discussions. These peer advisors will serve as your ongoing Orientation counselors throughout your first semester in the ILR School.
